dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That headline from The Times, embedded in the Genesis block by Alice Smith, really sets the tone, doesn't it? "Chancellor On Brink of Second Bailout for Banks."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That headline from The Times, embedded in the Genesis block by Alice Smith, really sets the tone, doesn't it? Chancellor On Brink of Second Bailout for Banks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Buried within the code of his Genesis block, Nakamoto embedded a reminder of what happens when too much trust is placed in banks. It was a headline from a British newspaper announcing the imminent bailout of the financial institutions following their collapse in 2008 and 2009: The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor On Brink of Second Bailout for Banks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. It's like this permanent critique of the traditional financial system, right there in the code. And that was back in 2009.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. It's like this permanent critique of the traditional financial system, right there in the code. And that was back in two thousand nine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Buried within the code of his Genesis block, Nakamoto embedded a reminder of what happens when too much trust is placed in banks. It was a headline from a British newspaper announcing the imminent bailout of the financial institutions following their collapse in 2008 and 2009: The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor On Brink of Second Bailout for Banks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now, uh, bitcoin's worth over a million dollars from that first block. It's wild to think how far it's come from just appealing to a small group of programmers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now, uh, bitcoin's worth over a million dollars from that first block. It's wild to think how far it's come from just appealing to a small group of programmers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first full decade of digital currency without banks kicked off a year later, on January 1, 2010, with the mining of bitcoin block number 32620, which rewarded its miner with 50 bitcoin, then worth less than a single penny but now worth about $375,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it wasn't all smooth sailing—remember the Mt. Gox hack? Four hundred and sixty million dollars stolen. That was a massive setback.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it wasn't all smooth sailing-remember the Mt. Gox hack? Four hundred and sixty million dollars stolen. That was a massive setback.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: February 2014 Japanese Bitcoin exchange Mt Gox is hacked and $460 million is stolen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Huge. And then you had Silk Road getting shut down by the FBI, which really highlighted the, um, darker uses early on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huge. And then you had Silk Road getting shut down by the F B I, which really highlighted the, um, darker uses early on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: October 2013 The FBI shutters online black market and drug bazaar Silk Road.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but despite all that, adoption kept growing. Like when Microsoft started accepting bitcoin for Xbox games back in 2014.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but despite all that, adoption kept growing. Like when Microsoft started accepting bitcoin for Xbox games back in twenty fourteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: December 2014 Following Overstocks lead, Microsoft starts accepting bitcoin for Xbox games.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then the speculation frenzy in 2017—bitcoin hit almost twenty thousand dollars! But it also produced so many worthless tokens and investor losses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then the speculation frenzy in twenty seventeen-bitcoin hit almost twenty thousand dollars! But it also produced so many worthless tokens and investor losses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the end of 2017, the frenzy in cryptocurrency speculation peaked with bitcoin at $20,000 and produced thousands of worthless cryptocurrency tokens and investor losses in the billions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but the underlying tech kept evolving. I mean, now you've got companies like JPMorgan and IBM diving into blockchain, which is kinda ironic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but the underlying tech kept evolving. I mean, now you've got companies like JPMorgan and I B M diving into blockchain, which is kinda ironic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact in a bit cruel irony, some of the most enthusiastic supporters and co-opters of blockchain technology today are those same big companies, ranging from IBM and Cargill to JPMorgan, that early bitcoin believers were rallying against.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. The very institutions bitcoin was rebelling against are now some of its biggest co-opters. Facebook with Libra, China with its own crypto…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. The very institutions bitcoin was rebelling against are now some of its biggest co-opters. Facebook with Libra, China with its own crypto...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: June 18, 2019 Facebook announces libra, a cryptocurrency partially backed by dollars. China announces its own crypto.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's this ongoing tension between decentralization and, uh, corporate control. Even though the idealists haven't given up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's this ongoing tension between decentralization and, uh, corporate control. Even though the idealists haven't given up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And breakthroughs in cryptography, like zero-knowledge proofs from Zcash, are still pushing things forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And breakthroughs in cryptography, like zero-knowledge proofs from Zcash, are still pushing things forward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: October 2016 Privacy coins gain traction after Zcash launches with zero-knowledge proofs, now being explored by the likes of JP Morgan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder where it'll all be in another decade.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder where it'll all be in another decade.

HostA: That headline from The Times, embedded in the Genesis block by Alice Smith, really sets the tone, doesn't it? "Chancellor On Brink of Second Bailout for Banks."

HostA: Yeah, and now, uh, bitcoin’s worth over a million dollars from that first block. It’s wild to think how far it’s come from just appealing to a small group of programmers.
HostB: But it wasn’t all smooth sailing—remember the Mt. Gox hack? Four hundred and sixty million dollars stolen. That was a massive setback.
HostA: Huge. And then you had Silk Road getting shut down by the FBI, which really highlighted the, um, darker uses early on.
HostB: Right, but despite all that, adoption kept growing. Like when Microsoft started accepting bitcoin for Xbox games back in 2014.
HostA: And then the speculation frenzy in 2017—bitcoin hit almost twenty thousand dollars! But it also produced so many worthless tokens and investor losses.
HostB: Yeah, but the underlying tech kept evolving. I mean, now you’ve got companies like JPMorgan and IBM diving into blockchain, which is kinda ironic.
HostA: Totally. The very institutions bitcoin was rebelling against are now some of its biggest co-opters. Facebook with Libra, China with its own crypto…
HostB: It’s this ongoing tension between decentralization and, uh, corporate control. Even though the idealists haven’t given up.
HostA: For sure. And breakthroughs in cryptography, like zero-knowledge proofs from Zcash, are still pushing things forward.
HostB: Makes you wonder where it’ll all be in another decade.
